metadata.name: GENERATIVE GLASSES #428
metadata.description:
After 4 months of coding the Generative Glasses is ready! I gained a lot of experience along the way and I really liked the creation process.

I wrote an article in which I report on the creation process in more detail. It can be found at the bottom of the page for related articles.

üëì thousands of different outputs are possible
üë®‚Äçüíª only code
üé® 3D (#webGL #threejs) and 2D (#html5canvas) layers 
üé• animated
üñ±Ô∏è interactive (+controls for mobile)
üòé augmented reality view
üü• different previews: abstract view, product design view, and 2 other view
üñºÔ∏è save images from current view in 4k - 3 different aspect ratio
üìº save animation (from server side) on http://carco.hu

Compositions:

- There is an abstract view where the parts of the glasses are scattered
- There is a front-right view
- Front-left view
- Top view
- Product design view that converts to split screen
- Front view where the object falls apart and starts from the abstract view again

First, one of the 6 compositions comes in and the animation starts. The system randomly determines which composition should be the first in the line. This will also be the saved image that the fxhash system creates. 

If you don't click or touch anything, the animation will loop continuously. If you click into the area anywhere, the controller will appear and the animation will stop. Until you get to the next composition and the animation stops, the pause button flashes until now you can't press anything, all buttons are disabled. If the animation has stopped, the buttons are enabled again, and you can move the camera in 3D space by dragging. 

The controls have left and right arrows that can be used to step between compositions. The animation restarts with the play button.

There are also a few other buttons:

- There is a save button which is a floppy disk. A menu will then appear, offering to save images of different proportions, with the default aspect ratio generated by the program code at the top. (Opening in a new window is required to save an image)

- There is a camera icon that restores the original camera view. It is worth pressing this before saving.

There are options that are not available for all compositions, they only appear if they are enabled in current composition:

- Switch split screen to main camera view, and back (4 squares icon)
- Shows and hide Editing lines (pair of compasses)
- Shows and hide Callout notations (pencil and ruler)
- Shows AR view and stop it (cube icon) (Opening in a new window is required to AR view, more info below)

Keyboard controls:

Press ‚Äú5‚Äù to save image to default aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú6‚Äù to save image to square aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú7‚Äù to save image to portrait aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú8‚Äù to save image to landscape aspect ratio

(Opening in a new window is required to save an image)

Press ‚ÄúArrowDown‚Äù for restores the original camera view
Press ‚ÄúD‚Äù to switch to next composition
Press ‚ÄúA‚Äù to switch  to previous composition
Press ‚ÄúS‚Äù to start animation
Press ‚ÄúSpacebar‚Äù to switch to split screen (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú1‚Äù to hide/show Editing lines (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú2‚Äù to hide/show Callout notations (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú3‚Äù to hide/show AR view (Opening in a new window is required to AR view, more info below)

AR view

If you have a camera on your device, you can try out how such glasses would suit you. This function is not available for all compositions, so if you cannot find the cube icon, tab to the next composition and click on the cube icon. I created this function with the help of Tensorflow face landmark detection package. It's not perfect, there are delays, but it's good enough to try out the glasses.

More information on how were made Generative Glasses in the related article below.

Thank you for your attention! Thanks for the support! Thanks for the opportunity fxhash and genart community! I hope I was able to contribute to generative art with my work!

@C4RC0
carco.hu

metadata.name: Inattendu #180
metadata.description:
"Inattendu" is a nod to my previous project "Voil√†" which produced some unexpected output because of a bug happening with Brave browser shield.
Simple things are often the best...
It seemed like people (and I) really liked these results, so I'm making them available for free as a new project.

The recursive algorithm is the same as the one used with "Voil√†", but the shapes are fully painted, it produces those interesting views.

Reserves for the people who minted my previous project "Voil√†" üíó

Press 's' to save a high res PNG:
- Square format: 2508x2508
- Portrait & Landscape format: 3128x2018

Made with p5js. France, April 2023, Nicazo.

metadata.description:
After 4 months of coding the Generative Glasses is ready! I gained a lot of experience along the way and I really liked the creation process.

I wrote an article in which I report on the creation process in more detail. It can be found at the bottom of the page for related articles.

üëì thousands of different outputs are possible
üë®‚Äçüíª only code
üé® 3D (#webGL #threejs) and 2D (#html5canvas) layers 
üé• animated
üñ±Ô∏è interactive (+controls for mobile)
üòé augmented reality view
üü• different previews: abstract view, product design view, and 2 other view
üñºÔ∏è save images from current view in 4k - 3 different aspect ratio
üìº save animation (from server side) on http://carco.hu

Compositions:

- There is an abstract view where the parts of the glasses are scattered
- There is a front-right view
- Front-left view
- Top view
- Product design view that converts to split screen
- Front view where the object falls apart and starts from the abstract view again

First, one of the 6 compositions comes in and the animation starts. The system randomly determines which composition should be the first in the line. This will also be the saved image that the fxhash system creates. 

If you don't click or touch anything, the animation will loop continuously. If you click into the area anywhere, the controller will appear and the animation will stop. Until you get to the next composition and the animation stops, the pause button flashes until now you can't press anything, all buttons are disabled. If the animation has stopped, the buttons are enabled again, and you can move the camera in 3D space by dragging. 

The controls have left and right arrows that can be used to step between compositions. The animation restarts with the play button.

There are also a few other buttons:

- There is a save button which is a floppy disk. A menu will then appear, offering to save images of different proportions, with the default aspect ratio generated by the program code at the top. (Opening in a new window is required to save an image)

- There is a camera icon that restores the original camera view. It is worth pressing this before saving.

There are options that are not available for all compositions, they only appear if they are enabled in current composition:

- Switch split screen to main camera view, and back (4 squares icon)
- Shows and hide Editing lines (pair of compasses)
- Shows and hide Callout notations (pencil and ruler)
- Shows AR view and stop it (cube icon) (Opening in a new window is required to AR view, more info below)

Keyboard controls:

Press ‚Äú5‚Äù to save image to default aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú6‚Äù to save image to square aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú7‚Äù to save image to portrait aspect ratio
Press ‚Äú8‚Äù to save image to landscape aspect ratio

(Opening in a new window is required to save an image)

Press ‚ÄúArrowDown‚Äù for restores the original camera view
Press ‚ÄúD‚Äù to switch to next composition
Press ‚ÄúA‚Äù to switch  to previous composition
Press ‚ÄúS‚Äù to start animation
Press ‚ÄúSpacebar‚Äù to switch to split screen (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú1‚Äù to hide/show Editing lines (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú2‚Äù to hide/show Callout notations (if it is available)
Press ‚Äú3‚Äù to hide/show AR view (Opening in a new window is required to AR view, more info below)

AR view

If you have a camera on your device, you can try out how such glasses would suit you. This function is not available for all compositions, so if you cannot find the cube icon, tab to the next composition and click on the cube icon. I created this function with the help of Tensorflow face landmark detection package. It's not perfect, there are delays, but it's good enough to try out the glasses.

More information on how were made Generative Glasses in the related article below.

Thank you for your attention! Thanks for the support! Thanks for the opportunity fxhash and genart community! I hope I was able to contribute to generative art with my work!

@C4RC0
carco.hu

metadata.name: Inattendu #274
metadata.description:
"Inattendu" is a nod to my previous project "Voil√†" which produced some unexpected output because of a bug happening with Brave browser shield.
Simple things are often the best...
It seemed like people (and I) really liked these results, so I'm making them available for free as a new project.

The recursive algorithm is the same as the one used with "Voil√†", but the shapes are fully painted, it produces those interesting views.

Reserves for the people who minted my previous project "Voil√†" üíó

Press 's' to save a high res PNG:
- Square format: 2508x2508
- Portrait & Landscape format: 3128x2018

Made with p5js. France, April 2023, Nicazo.

metadata.name: BINARY WORDS #321
metadata.description:
I drew my first 8x8 pixel binary image on 11/08/2022 with 'iloveyou' encoded for my wife, it was our 10-year anniversary on this day.  After that made this generative stuff for fxhash's birthday bash.

#fxhashturnsone

Donations:
25% to ThreeJs team

The image contains a binary coded word or phrase with a length of 8 characters. The grays represents 0, the other colors represents 1. One row -> one character. Should be proceed decoding from left to right and from top to bottom.

An example: 'iloveyou'

01101001
01101100
01101111
01110110
01100101
01111001
01101111
01110101

The fxrandom selects a word and the program converts it to binary data. After that, the background (ground and sky) is randomly generated from color schemes. Then the binary gray colors are drawn. Also the color of light next to null colors is randomly generated from color schemes. Random affects also the animation.

The animation stops when you do these interactions below, then restarts after a few seconds of inactivity.

Press spacebar to change:

- frame view -> without frame
- without frame -> original 8x8px size
- original 8x8px size -> frame view

Press 's' to save an svg from current view.

Notes:
- Build with ReactJs and TweenJs
- Every upcoming day, half of the remaining pieces are burned.

Happy Birthday fxhash community!
I'm glad to be among you!

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #2676
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js
